Comment: > Police Chief Brian O’Hara voiced frustration about DA Mary Moriarty deciding not to charge Adams with what would have been felony counts.  > “The Minneapolis Police Department did its job,” O’Hara said. “It identified and investigated a crime trend, identified and arrested a suspect, and presented a case file to the Hennepin County Attorney’s Office for consideration of charges”  > “This case impacted at least six victims and totaled over $20,000 in damages. Any frustration related to the charging decision of the Hennepin County Attorney should be directed solely at her office”  > “Our investigators are always frustrated when the cases they poured their hearts into are declined. In my experience, the victims in these cases often feel the same.”  Imagine doing all that work and the DA just slaps them in the wrist. There are *six victims* — where is their justice?
